review.comment_positive:
We booked 4 days motorbike tour with Ha Giang Loop Tour team and it was the best experience of our travelling across Vietnam. The scenery around Ha giang is so awesome and breathtaking. You have to do it! We made a reservation for loop with easy drivers. It was very good decision, because you can only sit and enjoy wonderful views. 
Our guide was Hung and he was so professional, helpful, kind and responsible. We made a friendship for the rest of life. Thank you for you caring, hardwork, time and love.
Communication and organisation was great. In price you have accommodations for all nights. You can choose in advance private room/dorm. Also all foods, fuel, easy drivers, one bottle of water for day, helmet, protection, everything what you need in these 3 daysâ€¦ It was worth every dolar. We sit all together in evening and was speaking with happy water (local alcohol from corn). Thank you for this adventure

Wir sind mit dem Nachtbus aus Cat Ba um 4 Uhr morgens eingetroffen und durften vor dem Check In fÃ¼r den Abend ( Zimmer waren alle gebucht) in einem sepersten Raum auf Matratzen schlafen. review.comment_positive:
We did the Ha Giang Loop and our tour guide named Phong was just amazing. While being extremely knowledgeable in the area he also is a lot of fun. He showed us the most stunning places and introduced us to his friends in the villages so we got a very authentic experience.

The staff and the especially also the owner of the hostel are very helpful and kind.

review.rating: Good value stay in Ha Giang
review.comment_positive: Viet and his team are excellent hosts. They went the extra mile to ensure my bus dropped me off directly at the hostel and when I left, that the bus picked me up at the doorstep. When I had an issue of needing to claim back money from an overcharged ticket, they arranged to have the money sent to the hostel for me to collect when I returned from my 3-day Ha Giang Loop tour. Laundry was handled promptly and at a reasonable charge. The breakfast is nice and on the top floor patio, which is a great place to lounge and enjoy the countryside view.
review.comment_negative:
While convenient for arranging a Ha Giang Loop tour, the hostel is some distance from the main town area. Eating options are a bit limited and pricey, although Coffee Viet a short distance to the right of the hostel served quite good food at reasonable prices.

My room had a kind of glazed window which overlooked another part of the hotel. When lights were on outside, it was impossible to block the light from shining in on your bed. For someone who finds it hard to sleep without darkness, it would be troubling. I suggested to the owner to install a blind on the window.

review.comment_positive:
This place would be an easy 10, its so close to perfect but there is one major problem with the room which stops it.

Bike rental - was great, 250v per day for a semi automatic with insurance. Bike worked well and no problems, had to leave drivers license as deposit. They let you practice on the bike and show you how to use it which is lovely.

Room - small and practical, very comfy bed, good shower and bathroom, and kept very clean. SO close to perfect but the issue below.. shower gel and shampoo provided. Good aircon. 

Breakfast - egg omlette sandwich, tea/coffee, good and simple. 

The owner is friendly.
review.comment_negative: in the standard double room the window just goes into a view of the inside of the property/ the corridor, this is not a problem in itself (although the room is labelled as having a city view) the MASSIVE problem is that this window has NO CURTAINS OR BLINDS and the lights literally dont turn off and this window is right next to the bed directly where your head/face is so its like literally a blinding white light in your face the entire time youâ€™re trying to sleep. We stayed in a room on arrival and another room on return and both the rooms had the exact same problem. This is such a big issue and i cant understand why they would not put blinds on the windows, if you dont have an eyemask it will be very hard to sleep.

review.comment_positive: We had the best 3D2N tour with these guys! They looked after us so well from start to finish, keeping us safe, weâ€™ll fed and entertained the whole time (and the weather didnâ€™t make that easy). My tour guide and easy rider were both so friendly and made me feel so comfortable about an experience I was super anxious about before we started and I have to say itâ€™s one of the greatest things Iâ€™ve ever done. Couldnâ€™t recommend these guys enough! (If youâ€™re fussy with food like me, they do put on enough of a spread that you will always have something to eat but I would recommend bringing snacks like chocolate and crisps just in case, my boyfriend really enjoyed all the food but I can be a pain as I donâ€™t eat noodles or egg). The home stays are basic but comfortable and you always have a warm shower at the end of the day, you can pay extra for a private room too if youâ€™re travelling as a couple. A super special thank you to Hinh for making this trip so special and for teaching us how to drink happy water like a pro!

review.comment_positive:
Honestly - great. 
Accom - very clean. Easy to get to from bus. Polite English speaking staff. Wifi very good. 
Ended up renting bikes here too. We were so lucky to arrive the day they received a new bike delivery! 4km in the odometer. No issues around the whole loop (so canâ€™t say Iâ€™ve tested their services if things go wrongâ€¦)
Read a lot of reviews around town about places ignoring/being rude if you just wanted to hire a bike instead of join an easy rider tourâ€¦. This place paid us attention without being pushy - great vibe - no regrets about renting from here!
They also let us have a shower (and borrow towels) before getting back on the bus. Thank you!

review.comment_positive:
We just did the 4 days Ha Giang Loop tour with the Ha Giang Hostel team, and it was the most scenic and most memorable part of our trip in Vietnam! The views are breathtaking and the people very welcoming. Minh was our guide, along with Cuong and Khoa riding our bikes. They were super friendly and we partied together every night while learning some Vietnamese! Minh was very good with planning the trip so we avoided most of the crowds of other tourists that we could see at some spots. The 4 days tour is really worth it, as you get to see a lot more instead of just rushing back on the last day. Weâ€™re traveling with our 10 year old son, and Minh was like a big brother to him! 
By the way, the hostel itself is clean and comfortable!

review.rating: Great place to stay for doing Ha Giang Loop!
review.comment_positive:
Stayed here twice for one night at a time, one night  before and one night after doing the Ha Giang Loop.
The hotel lets guests store luggage while doing the loop. The rooms are basic and clean with nice hot showers and comfortable beds. There is a decent place to eat directly opposite the hotel. Staff were friendly and spoke good English. They organised buses from and back to Hanoi for us. They also washed and dried our laundry overnight after the loop so we had nice clean clothes to take with us! Good value stay - would stay again!

review.rating: THE place to go in Ha Giang - highly recommended!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra NÃºi
review.comment_positive:
We, my partner and I, stayed here twice, upon arrival and departure of our 4-day bike tour on the loop, and would definitely return and recommend to everyone looking for an amazing spot in Ha Giang.

We arrived in the middle of the night (4 am) via Sleeper Bus and booked the prior night in the Two-Bedroom with Mountain View - check-in was super smooth. The room was very clean, smelt good, had a modern taste and mountain view ;-) The hostel is not located in the middle of Ha Giang city, which is very good. Still, you get to the city by foot in just a few mins.

We booked our motorbikes directly on-site - 5 days with insurance and a good introduction into semi-automatic. Hemelts are provided. After a day of practice, we drove off into the unknown by our own (tours are offered) ;-)

Breakfast is served at the rooftop - if you are lucky and catch the tables next to the railing, you will enjoy a beautiful view. Next to fruits and coffee / tea, you are served BÃ¡nh mÃ¬ with an omelette - perfect to start into the day!

The owner is THE man to organize EVERYTHING! :-) May it be an issue on the road with the bike, a private driver to Sapa (the best we had in Vietnam) or if you forget something at the hostel (he sent a driver to our next destination to bring it to us at no add. cost - thank you so much again!). Of course, the whole staff is very, very friendly :-) With this kind of safety in the back, you do not need to worry about anything!

We will definitely return!

General hint: Make sure to bring your International Driver License and the national one if you want to drive on your own (you will meet police on the loop asking for BOTH).

review.rating: Sleep here before you Ha Giang loop;)
review.comment_positive: The staff is very nice and speaks wonderful English. They help you throughout booking of everything you need: Ha Giang loops, bike rentals, bus transfers and more. The price is very cheap and the hostel very nice, with laundry service as well.

review.comment_negative: Le ragazze alla reception non sono state cosÃ¬ gentili, molto svogliate, al contrario dei ragazzi che sono stati  gentili e disponibili. Nella nostra stanza al primo piano c'era un perenne odore di muffa che anche con il condizionatore su dry, non siamo riusciti a togliere. Le moto 150 che abbiamo noleggiato per l'ha Giang Loop ci ha fatto passare 3 giorni di ansia perchÃ© non eravamo sicuri avesse retto fino alla fine, delle 3 che ci hanno proposto Le prime 2 erano in pessime condizioni, una non restava accesa e l'altra ballava la ruota ed Ã¨ rimasta senza benzina letteralmente 150m dopo che siamo partiti. La terza e ultima che dovevamo per forza prendere continuava a fare rumori strani e aveva sia problemi di carburazione che di trasmissione, e ogni mattina prima di ripartire abbiamo passato 10minuti a tentare di accenderla, per il prezzo di 550'000/day si puÃ² trovare molto di meglio. Nemmeno il portatelefono per poter guardare la mappa mentre si viaggia. Abbiamo preferito rientrare un giorno prima per non rischiare di rimanere a piedi in mezzo alle montagne.

We stayed at Ha Giang Hostel after arriving in Ha Giang to stay at another place. Our original place was loud and dirty so we called and took a taxi to Ha Giang Hostel. As soon as we arrived, we knew this place was much better. The whole property is clean and comfortable. The rooms were clean and everything worked well. There was an aircon and fan in the room and the private bathroom was clean and offered all needed amenities. 

The staff was super friendly and welcoming and made sure that we had everything we needed. After seeing how nice the property and staff were - we actually decided to book our Ha Giang Loop trip through Ha Giang Hostel instead of our original company. We were so glad we did and kept saying that everything works out for a reason.

The breakfast was also nice!

The Tour was well organized, and although it is a Hard loop to drive, we felt safe all the time. The drivers are very nice and friendly and we had a really great time! 
Especially our guide Minh did an exceptional Job at taking care of us, led us to the most stunning views we have ever experienced, leading our Group safe and sound, respected our wishes, Speaking english very well  and making lots of Funny Jokes. 
Our drivers Minh and Tung did a great Job!

review.comment_positive: best hostel Iâ€™ve stayed in Asia. helpful front desk spotless clean bathrooms and bed area. bunk beds comfy. hired bikes got a map and route guidance and onward coach all sorted through accom reception all at great prices. bike was really good quality for ha giang loop heard horror storyâ€™s from others we met along the way at the end who rented from elsewhere. host went above and beyond to get us on the night bus the evening we got back rather than conning us into another night stay super helpful even dropped us to the buss last stop so we could make it in time. yummy breakfast on top floor also. plenty of hot water in showers free soaps and plenty of toilet roll. sent off on night bus with free large bottles of water each which was a nice touch ! would recommend only staying here a lot of others said there accom was rather run down in ha giang this looks all brand new ! also can store your bags here free of charge during the loop and any bags you take with you they provide straps you attach to the bike on day one.

review.rating: Noisy and small room but very nice staff and good price.
review.comment_positive:
Special award to the staff that was really adorable and helpful. 
They provide everything you need to do the loop (motobike and gear) but they could be more specific and take more time when explaining the trip. They just show you the map and that s all. I would have expected more details and advice. 
Very good quality motobikes. 
The room price is cheap but you should know it is very noisy. 
However it s very clean and cheap so it s good deal anyway. 
We met no police at all on the loop but we bought the international driving licence online the hostel proposed just in case. 
It is possible to have a shower before you go after the loop.
review.comment_negative:
very noisy so don t expect to have calm and silence at all.

review.comment_positive: I had a fantastic stay in Ha Giang Hostel. It's very close to the night bus stop where they dropped me off. Just walked for 2 mins. In the middle of night it's not a problem at all. The room was very clean. Breakfast with the view was great. And I was planning to rent a motorbike from them but end up with joining the Ha Giang loop tour with them. It was one of my favourite memories in my life for sure. The tour was very safe that the drivers always drove at a low speed to keep passengers safe and meantime you can absolutely enjoy the landscape on your ride. Homestays were awesome if you love the local vibes. People were very friendly and we always had a welcome party everyday! Thanks so much to our tour guide Tom and our drivers. The staff from the hostel was very helpful for everything. I'll definitely come back and do the loop again. :)

AuÃŸerdem gibt es morgens ein kleines, aber leckeres FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck.
Wir haben uns bei dem Hostel 2 Mopeds fÃ¼r den Loop geliehen, die RÃ¤der waren prima in Schuss. Wir haben auch die Insurance abgeschlossen und bekamen die Kosten fÃ¼r einen platten Reifen anstandslos ersetzt.
AuÃŸerdem haben uns die Jungs vom Hostel gezeigt wie wir Ã¼berhaupt auf den RÃ¤dern fahren und wir hÃ¤tten sie bei Problemen jederzeit anrufen kÃ¶nnen.
Der Staff war sehr bemÃ¼ht und ausgesprochen freundlich.
Obwohl in dem Hostel ein reges Kommen und Gehen herrscht, war es nicht Ã¼bermÃ¤ÃŸig laut.
Was wir auch positiv fanden: niemand hat versucht uns eine gefÃ¼hrte Loop Tour oder sonst irgendwas anzudrehen.
Und last but not least: wir konnten fÃ¼r die Dauer des Loops kostenlos unser GepÃ¤ck aufbewahren lassen.

Seife im Badezimmer wÃ¤re schÃ¶n gewesen. Ein FÃ¶hn hat gefehlt.

In terms of service, it's very good. Our two drivers: Thin and Vu drive very smoothly, always ensuring safety and taking care of customers. Whatever you need or have any questions, we will answer them.
The other drivers in the group are also very friendly and funny. Every night we can drink corn wine and sing karaoke until morning ğŸ˜…

Excelente hotel para quedarse en Ha Giang antes o despuÃ©s de empezar el loop calidad - precio (12â‚¬ dos personas con desayuno). Habitaciones sencillas pero sÃºper nuevas, espaciosas y el baÃ±o muy bien - ducha separada del WC y agua caliente. 
El personal es extremadamente amable, y nos hicieron mil favores y ayudaron con muchas cosas (e.g. llamar por vÃ­deollamada al hotel de Hanoi para encontrar un documento olvidado en la maleta q habiamos dejado allÃ­)
El desayuno es muy simple pero el bocadillo de tortilla estÃ¡ muy bueno, en el rooftop que tiene unas buenas vistas. AdemÃ¡s tienen servicio de alquiler de motos y nos dieron una nuevÃ­sima. Muy recomendable comparado con otros que estuvimos en Ha Giang.

we rented us semi-automatic scooters, he explained the route and afterwards arranged us a transfer from Ha Giang as per our request while we were still enjoying our ride.

review.comment_positive: We have spend only a night but took the Ha Giang Tour. It was super great and the team was awful !! They have booked a bus for us to head to Sa Pa aswell. The bus ran late but was great one anyway so no complaints at all !

Perfekt um von dort aus den Ha Giang Loop zu fahren. Man kann dort Motorbikes mieten (inkl. Versicherung), die wirklich in einem Top Zustand sind. Man bekommt auch noch eine Einweisung und Helme. 
Das FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck war ein frisches Banh Mi mit Ei auf der Dachterrasse. Total lecker. 
GegenÃ¼ber befinden sich mehrere Restaurants. Die Zimmer mit Fenster sind klasse.

review.comment_positive:
Staff is very helpful.
Good location and wifi.
Atmosphere is nice and clean.
Room is clean and quiet.
NhÃ¢n viÃªn khÃ¡ thÃ¢n thiá»‡n. KhÃ¡ch sáº¡n cÃ³ chá»— Ä‘á»ƒ xe an toÃ n. Gia Ä‘Ã¬nh tÃ´i Ä‘Ã£ cÃ³ ká»³ nghá»‰ á»•n.

The manager of the hostel is a very nice guy who speaks English perfectly. The hostel arranges the Ha Giang loop tour in small groups, up to 10-12 persons. The tour guides speak English pretty good. The easy rider drivers are driving very carefully and are very good drivers, so you can enjoy the scenery, which is amazing. We did the 4 days, 3 nights tour and I can truly advise you to book the tour with this hostel. Super good Vietnamese food for lunch and dinner. Everything is arranged for, so all you have to do is enjoy the trip. You also do some hikes and visit a cave. And every day enough stops to make beautifull pictures. If you want to drive yourself and you don't have an international drivers license the drivers will help you to pass the police checkpoints. If you can afford it, book a private room: only 12 dollars extra for 3 nights. Thebeds are really more comfortable than the dorm beds. I give this tour a 10+ !!
review.comment_negative: Don't get a room on the second floor as it is close to the reception and there are guests checking in during the night, which can be rather noisy.

review.comment_positive:
LOVED EVERYTHING !!
- The owner and his staff were so so friendly and welcoming! We arrived on the sleeper bus at 4:30am and there was someone there to greet us and let us into our rooms.
- The hostel is VERY easy to find. You honestly canâ€™t miss it. The location is great
- Room was very clean and comfortable. Very spacious and nice hot showers!!
- We wanted to do the Ha Giang Loop by ourselves without a guide and the owner of Ha Giang Hostel sat with us for half an hour explaining the best routes, which roads to avoid, the best Homestayâ€™s, where to get fuel etc. He honestly made our trip so much simpler. We originally hired the bikes for 5 days but the weather was predicted to start storming so we came back a day early and without even having to ask they gave us our money back for the day we didnâ€™t use! 

Such a great hostel with the BEST STAFF !!

review.comment_positive:
Perfect starting point for doing the so called Ha Giang Loop, which has the most beautiful landscapes I have ever seen.
The staff at the hostel was really really kind and helped me solving a problem with my sim card.
review.comment_negative:
The tour I booked at the hostel was not worth it. 
Obviously the landscapes are amazing but I would have preferred going by myself for different reasons:
1. The guides didn't speak english and didn't explain anything about the place and the interesting people living there (even if we asked we Google Translate, they often didn't know what to say)
2. We stopped in super crowded places, just the time to take an Instagram picture (so it's really annoying if you don't care about that)
3. You had to pay for extra water and the food wasn't that much, especially for breakfast. Considering the quite expensive price I've paid, I would have expected to have water and coffee included

review.rating: Pessima esperienza e delusione al seguito
review.comment_positive: Non saprei dire visto la pessima esperienza. L'unica nota positiva che posso dare la disponibilitÃ  della ragazza Tom, l'unica educata e cortese. Il responsabile dovrebbe imparare! In ogni caso per essere un ostello, la pulizia non Ã¨ malvagia.
review.comment_negative:
Siamo arrivati pensando di stare 3 notti, avendole giÃ  prenotate su booking, ma ce ne siamo andati 1 giorno prima, mai successo nel nostro viaggio in Vietnam, di solito stiamo di piÃ¹ non di meno. Neanche eravamo arrivati che ci avevano mandato un messaggio dicendo che se non avremmo confermato entro le 18 del giorno di arrivo non ci avrebbero mantenuto la stanza, e giÃ  non Ã¨ un buon biglietto da visita, non ti devo pregare per assicurarmi la stanza.
Arriviamo, neanche ci dÃ  le chiavi, che subito ci vuole vendere il tour, dal momento in cui gli diciamo che non ci interessa e che volevamo solo rilassarci, non ci rivolge piÃ¹ la parola neanche per un ciao. 
Il giorno dopo andiamo alla reception per chiedere di lavarci per favore i vestiti, e uno dei ragazzi, ci dice siete qua per il checkout! No noi abbiamo prenotato 3 notti, e poi insiste nel chiederci se comunque volessimo andare via prima. CosÃ¬ abbiamo deciso di annullare una notte.
Praticamente loro guadagnano sui tour, se tu non fai il tour con loro, stai solo occupando una stanza inutilmente, non sei gradito.
Se stai cercando un posto dove riposarti e fare trekking o hiking in solitaria, Ha Giang non Ã¨ il posto giusto. A partire dall'affitto dei motorini che se non hai la patente Internazionale non te li danno e in piÃ¹, mai visto cosÃ¬ tanti controlli sulle strade. In giro per il Vietnam fanno le peggio cose sulle strade, ma qui puntano i turisti, per fare multe per qualsiasi motivo.
Oltre a questa disavventura, la seconda notte ho dovuto fare la doccia fredda.

review.comment_positive:
Brekfast is bread with egg, banana and instant coffee/tea. It is okay, but nothing special.
The room is cheap and convienient from bus station.
review.comment_negative:
The room does not have window and ventilation, so the humidity is high and there is not air in the room.
The room was not properly cleaned and the sheets were dirty.
The room does not include toilet paper and you have to ask for it in the reception.

Be careful with renting a motorbike, as they will want to take your passport and driving licence during the whole rental period.
The motorbikes you will see parked in front is not the ones you will get, after signing the contract they will give you an old bike and you cannot choose it for yourself as they would say it is the only one for you. Even the price is the same as for the new one.
Read carefully the contract, as insurance will cover only the exterior of the motorbike and the tyres, all the other things is excluded. If you will broke down on the road all expences is on you and they dont take responsibility , you will have to manage to return bike by yourself and after their cheking, they will decide it is your foult that the bike broke down. Full fuel tank is also not included. And if somebody will steal motorbike, you gave to pay the full price for the new one (even if it is an old bike you are renting and even if they say it is not possible for bike to be stolen, which sounds like a scam).

review.comment_positive: Great jumping off point for the Ha Giang loop. We rented two Honda blades here too and they were new and reliable. The helmets are a bit big (for women) so bring a baseball cap or something to put on under. The room was clean and very comfortable. Best part is the upstairs rooftop where they serve breakfast in the morning. The hostel also organized a sleeper bus that picked us up directly from the hostel.

I'm not only rating this Hostel as accommodation but mainly for their Ha Giang loop tour, which I highly recommend taking with them!

Firstly, we got a very nice private room for free one day prior to the tour. Cleanliness was on a spot, the beds were very comfortable, and the room was very bright and spacious. Nothing to complain about!

And now the tour itself. It was THE HIGHLIGHT of our trip in Vietnam, no joking! We had an amazing guide Viet - he's the sweetest person ever, very helpful, very friendly and highly experienced driver.

We've chosen one heavy rider for one of us, and self riding one motorbike. Everything was excellent, we had some heavy rain and bad weather along the route, but it didn't ruin our experience, because you can't control the weather. Of course, we had some sunny days and beautiful views too. We really enjoyed this tour and wouldn't take it with someone else, as we figured out other tours are with much bigger groups (10+ people), often more expensive, etc.

We ended only with one other couple, so our group had only five people including our guide.

If we're returning back to Vietnam, we will definitely take this tour with Ha Giang Hostel again!

All of the stuff working there are just nice and helpful people. The owner managed for us all the buses and all our requests.

review.comment_positive:
+dorms met gordijnen 
+kluisje voor je dagrugzak
+warme douches 
+handoek
+mooi dakterras waar je overdag in de zon kan zitten en waar in de ochtend het ontbijt is 
+Vriendelijk personeel 
+er werd een take away ontbijt geregeld toen ik vroeg de bus terug naar Hanoi nam

Ik heb ook de 4 dagen 3 nachten loop geboekt bij het hostel. 
Ik wilde zelf rijden, maar op aanraden van wat andere backpackers uit het hostel toch voor een easyrider gekozen, omdat ik geen motorrijbewijs heb. Uiteindelijk 3 politie checkpoints tegen gekomen. Ook de zelf rijders zijn daar met wat handigheidjes van de easyriders langs gekomen.
De loop was een enorm gave ervaring. Ik raad hem iedereen aan. We waren de eerste 3 dagen met een groep van 12 en de laatste dag splitste we op en gingen we met 3 man verder. Onderweg erg gezellige avonden gehad.

Speciale dank naar mijn easy rider: Xuan Kustes! 

Tip: pizza restaurant tegenover het hostel. Als afwisseling tussen het heerlijke Vietnamese eten door.

review.comment_positive: I brought a group of friends to tour Ha Giang again (having previously stayed with Jasmine Hostel) and choose Ha Giang Hostel because it is a bright and modern spacious hostel with clean facilities, private and comfy bunk beds and an amazing rooftop area serving breakfast with a view. All the staff were very friendly and competent. They all spoke English and there were no misunderstandings which makes traveling in Vietnam so much easier. The manager was on site and very friendly. All the motorbikes are cleaned every day to look like new and are well maintained. All the prices are good market value and transparent. I would strongly recommend against going to the Mr. Hung restaurant opposite as it is usual to find good western food outside of major cities in Vietnam and this was no exception. If you are happy to use a bit of Google translate then walk further up the road to a local Vietnamese which you will see is much busier and cheaper.

Der Loop war super - auch wenn wir echt schlechtes Wetter hatte. Mein Easy Rider VÄ©nh ist sehr sicher gefahren und hat mich mit Regensachen versorgt, so dass ich nicht nass wurde. review.rating: Awesome people in a perfect hostel for an Ha Giang trip
review.room_type: GiÆ°Æ¡Ì€ng Trong PhoÌ€ng NguÌ‰ TÃ¢Ì£p ThÃªÌ‰ Cho CaÌ‰ Nam VaÌ€ NÆ°Ìƒ 6 GiÆ°Æ¡Ì€ng
review.comment_positive:
Highly recommanded ! The hostel is really good and the personnal helpfull. We arrived at 3:00 am and we were able to check-in, the room was really clean as well as the shared bathroom (soap available). 
It is also a good spot to rent bike. We had troubles with a bike and the guy was absolutely available to quickly find a solution, we wait maximum 15 min while being 5 hours away from the hostel. At the end of our motor bike trip, even if we didn't have a room anymore, we were able to take a shower before leaving. 
Finnaly, i forget a jacket at the hostel and the personnel find it and send it to Hanoi to allow me get it back, so kind.

review.rating: Super Unterkunft fÃ¼r den Ha Giang Loop!
review.room_type: PhÃ²ng 2 GiÆ°á»ng ÄÆ¡n NhÃ¬n Ra NÃºi
review.comment_positive: Wir haben die Tour Ã¼ber das Hostel gebucht und wÃ¼rden es jederzeit wieder so machen. Die Easy-Rider waren alle super nett und wir haben uns rundum wohl gefÃ¼hlt. Vor der Abreise haben wir eine Nacht im Doppelzimmer verbracht, was einfach nur perfekt war.

Room was nice, staff very helpful, breakfast is omlette in the bun and some fruit. Room was cleaned everyday and bathroom was good. You can rent bikes here and I can recommend that. We didnt book bike in advance and there was still a lot to choose from. There is plenty to choose from and you can try as many as you like until you find your fit.
Also, there is an restourant across the street where the the food is great and where everyone go.
review.comment_negative: Coriander in the omlette should be optional and can be made with less oil :)

review.comment_positive:
The staff was really really nice and helped us organize our Trip. We booked our motorbike and all the Transfers via Ha Giang Hostel. We also got an early breakfast due to our early departure. They serve a hot breakfast (bread with egg, Butter or Jam) and you get some fresh fruits and biscuits.
When something seemed off with the Bike, we just told the staff and they fixed it during the night.
We would totally recommend this place for a stay in Ha Giang.
